body_content.explanation:
abbreviation for 
large language model : a complex mathematical representation of language that is based on very large amounts of data and allows computers to produce language that seems similar to what a human might say:
examples: LLMs represent a major advancement in artificial intelligence.
LLMs are fundamentally changing the way search algorithms work.

body_content.explanation: abbreviation for Master of Laws, a university degree in law that you can get after your first degree:
examples: He graduated in 1970 and obtained an LLM the next year.
As an LLM student soon to graduate, I feel very fortunate to have had this professor.
